title: rustc ignores LD_LIBRARY_PATH
body:
Hello,

Not sure this is intended behaviour, but `rustc` ignores `LD_LIBRARY_PATH`.

I am trying to compile code that uses `rust-zmq` like this:

```
 $ LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/home/simao/Downloads/zeromq-4.0.1/out/lib/ rustc -L /home/simao/rust/.rust/src/github.com/erickt/rust-zmq-0.1/ example.rs  

error: linking with `cc` failed with code 1
note: cc arguments: -L/usr/lib/rust/rust-0.8/lib/rustc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib -m64 -o example example.o -L/usr/lib/rust/rust-0.8/lib/rustc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib -lstd-6c65cf4b443341b1-0.8 -L/usr/lib/rust/rust-0.8/lib/rustc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib -lextra-a7c050cfd46b2c9a-0.8 -L/home/simao/rust/.rust/src/github.com/erickt/rust-zmq-0.1 -lzmq-2cbaa875f4cd9f40-0.4 -lrustrt -lrt -lpthread -lzmq -L/home/simao/rust/.rust/src/github.com/erickt/rust-zmq-0.1 -L/home/simao/rust/.rust -L/home/simao/rust -lrt -ldl -lm -lmorestack -lrustrt -Wl,-rpath,$ORIGIN/../../../usr/lib/rust/rust-0.8/lib/rustc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib -Wl,-rpath,$ORIGIN/.rust/src/github.com/erickt/rust-zmq-0.1 -Wl,-rpath,/usr/lib/rust/rust-0.8/lib/rustc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib -Wl,-rpath,/home/simao/rust/.rust/src/github.com/erickt/rust-zmq-0.1
note: /usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lzmq
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status

error: aborting due to previous error
```

But if I use this path with `-L` it compiles and runs properly:

```
 $ rustc -L /home/simao/Downloads/zeromq-4.0.1/out/lib/ -L /home/simao/rust/.rust/src/github.com/erickt/rust-zmq-0.1/ example.rs
 rust   ./example 
version: 4 0 1
starting client
rcvhwm: 10
sndhwm: 10
identity: identity
client sending foo
server received foo
server sending hello foo
client recieving hello foo
 rust   
```

Should `rustc` be aware of `LD_LIBRARY_PATH`?

Thanks
